data.title: Prof. Piotr Sitarski – “The Sun Rises Once a Day” and “Matthew's Days”
data.meta_description: Piotr Sitarski delivers a lecture on Henryk Kluba's The Sun Rises Once a Day (Słońce wschodzi raz na dzień) and Witold Leszczyński's Matthew's Days (Żywot Mateusza). First, he introduces the general themes of both films, then discusses each of them individually. He describes the political context of the late 1960s in Poland, when both films were made. The author also talks about the artistic context, also in relation to new wave movements. He looks at the “separateness of both films, their uniqueness, placing them within the genre of a film parable, universal, minimalist, showing nature in its simplicity and symbolism. He also talks about the role of the folklorism in both films.
